pullRequest.body:
In this PR, we formalize the factorization axiom which asserts that a morphism in a category can be factored as a morphism in a certain class `W‚ÇÅ` followed by a morphism in a class `W‚ÇÇ`. A functorial version of the axiom is also  defined.

---

nodes.body: üöÄ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by erdOne.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9306950878/job/25617226018)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9306950878/job/25617225640)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9306950878/job/25617225843)

Maybe we should make `fun {X Y : C} (f : X ‚ü∂ Y) => Nonempty (MapFactorizationData W‚ÇÅ W‚ÇÇ f)` into a `MorphismProperty`? It will be useful for say immersions and quasi-projective morphisms (on Hartshorne).

Looking at the material below, I think this definition is quite orthogonal to them and will not shorten any proof though. What do you think?
Thanks for the suggestion. I have added `MorphismProperty.comp` and a lemma `comp_eq_top_iff`. It also seems to me that it is essentially independent of the rest of the code though.
Yeah I was expecting the answer to be "the idea might have potential but perhaps in a separate PR" but I brought it up just in case.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(CategoryTheory/MorphismProperty): the factorization axiom
